channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: French Premier Announces ‘Exceptional’ Measures Against Terrorism
item.description: Prime Minister Manuel Valls made his statements after France formally charged and detained four men accused of providing logistical support to Amedy Coulibaly, a gunman involved in the recent attacks.
item.dc:creator: By MAÏA de la BAUME and DAN BILEFSKY

item.title: Taliban Fissures in Afghanistan Are Seen as an Opening for ISIS
item.description: The long absence of the movement’s reclusive leader, Mullah Muhammad Omar, appears to be driving discontent within the ranks of the Afghan Taliban.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By TAIMOOR SHAH and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN

item.title: As Houthis Besiege Yemen’s Capital, President Is Silent
item.description: A Houthi rebel leader sought to allay concerns, but there was no public statement from President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi as militiamen surrounded his residence.
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: Houthi militiamen on a road outside the presidential palace in Sana, the Yemeni capital, on Wednesday.

item.title: Letter From India: Offended? In India, You Win
item.description: The country grants near-absolute freedom to the news media, but also to the offended, who can pursue criminal charges against editors and reporters.
item.dc:creator: By MANU JOSEPH

item.title: North Korean Leader May Visit Moscow, Russia Says
item.description: The possible visit would be Kim Jong-un’s first trip abroad since taking control of his country in late 2011, an official said.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: U.S. Outpost in Cuba to Step Out of the Shadows
item.description: A building in Havana that has long been a center of intrigue and was once the American Embassy will again serve its diplomatic purpose amid the new détente with Cuba.
item.dc:creator: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
item.media:description: Poles outside the American interests section building in Havana once flew black flags that hid a Times Square-style ticker installed by President George W. Bush.

item.title: News Analysis: Rise of ISIS Deprives Obama of a Mantle of Peacemaker
item.description: President Obama wanted to use his State of the Union address to declare that he had fulfilled his vow to end two overseas wars, but the wars did not exactly cooperate.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: China Is Said to Be Doing Away With Goals for Arrests and Convictions
item.description: The Communist Party has demanded an end to secretive performance benchmarks for the police, prosecutors and courts, the state-run news media said.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: New Yorker Writer Is Surprised by Byline in Chinese Newspaper: His Own
item.description: Peter Hessler, who is also the author of books about China, disavowed an article that appeared with his byline in China Daily, a state-run newspaper.
item.dc:creator: By JESS YU

item.title: Bank of England Dissenters Dropped Call to Raise Rates, Meeting Minutes Show
item.description: All nine policy makers voted this month to keep the benchmark rate steady amid concerns about inflation, which fell in December to a 15-year low.
item.dc:creator: By CHAD BRAY

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: How to End Libya’s War
item.description: The West must strike a neutral stance and stop the flow of guns and cash to both warring factions.
item.dc:creator: By JASON PACK

item.title: Palestinian Stabs Up to a Dozen Israelis in Rush-Hour Attack in Tel Aviv
item.description: The assailant, who attacked a bus driver as well as passengers around 7:30 a.m., was shot and wounded by security forces as he tried to escape.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER and IRIT PAZNER GARSHOWITZ

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Line Drawn on Purported Corruption in Calligraphy
item.description: To judge from warnings by Chinese Communist Party officials, the calligraphy racket can be as sordid and ruthless as a rigged wrestling match.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:credit: Adam Dean for The New York Times
item.media:description: Examining calligraphy set for auction in Hong Kong. On the mainland, the head of the Communist Party’s main antigraft agency says crooked officials are accepting high fees for shoddy works.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: North Korea Dabbles in Reform
item.description: Economic liberalization holds great promise for improving the lives of millions of the country’s citizens.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREI LANKOV

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Obama Urges Congress Not to Leave a Trade Vacuum for China
item.description: He warned lawmakers in his State of the Union address that failure to take action on trade legislation could be tantamount to ceding America’s leadership role to Beijing.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE
item.media:description: President Obama, in his State of the Union address on Tuesday, said: “China wants to write the rules for the world’s fastest-growing region. That would put our workers and our businesses at a disadvantage.”

item.title: Shanghai Blames Local Officials and Police in Deadly New Year’s Stampede
item.description: The city dismissed two officials Wednesday after concluding that poor preparations and lax policing led to the panic that left 36 people dead.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Argentine Leader Criticizes Dead Official
item.description: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner and her allies lashed out at Alberto Nisman, who was found dead in his home, questioning whether he had allied himself with forces seeking to weaken her government.
item.dc:creator: By JONATHAN GILBERT and SIMON ROMERO

item.title: Open Source: Paris Mayor Plans to Sue Fox Over False Reports of ‘No-Go Zones’
item.description: Mayor Anne Hidalgo announced plans to take legal action against Fox News for inaccurate reports that areas of her city are Muslim-ruled enclaves.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: World Briefing: Britain: Man Pleads Guilty to Terrorism Charges
item.description: A British man who joined a jihadist group to fight in Syria and then returned to Britain after faking his death has pleaded guilty to four terrorism offenses, the London police said.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN CASTLE

item.title: World Briefing: Guyana: President Announces Date for Elections
item.description: President Donald Ramotar, who suspended Parliament in November to avoid a no-confidence vote, announced Tuesday that general elections would be held on May 11.
item.dc:creator: By GIRISH GUPTA
